definition: body/life/oneself/personally/one's morality and conduct/the main part of a structure or body/pregnant/classifier for sets of clothes: suit, twinset/Kangxi radical 158

sentences.english: He bowed down to the Queen.
When leaving the court you have to bow yourself out as you go.
sentences.chinese: 當離開朝廷時，你得躬身退出。

sentences.english: Bow down, archangels, in your dim abode.
sentences.chinese: 躬身致意吧，大天使，在你幽暗的居所。

sentences.english: Cadmus gave thanks and, stooping down, kissed the foreign soil, then lifting his eyes, greeted the surrounding mountains.
sentences.chinese: 卡德摩斯謝過神明，躬身親吻這片異鄉的土地，然後。

sentences.english: The students bowed to the professor when they met him.
sentences.chinese: 見到教授，學生們躬身施禮。

sentences.english: All the men in the court bowed before the king as he entered.
sentences.chinese: 國王進來時，宮廷裏所有人都向他躬身行禮。

definition: to half rise out of one's chair (a polite gesture)
to cup one fist in the other hand (as a sign of respect)
to cup one's hands in obeisance or greeting/(fig.) submissive
to return a politeness/to present a gift in return
to follow your orders/to do as you bid
to petition for retirement (old)/to ask for leave to withdraw/to ask to be excused
to bow deeply, starting upright with arms straight out in front, one hand cupped in the other, then moving the hands down to one's knees as one bows, keeping the arms straight (a form of greeting)
